Mini 1645: BooneyToonz I - The Creepy Caravansary




GAME OVER


Oh, well, hello there! Welcome to BooneyToonz Resort. I am Boonskiies. You shall have a nice stay here. I hope your plane ride
wasn't too rough because of the storm. Sporatic storms happen at the most inconvenient times. It should clear up by the morning.
We have a long day ahead tomorrow, I have scheduled a plethora of activities for you all. Your vacation shall be one you will not forget.

Village idiot, village idiot. They all say I am village idiot. I am not village idiot. They...are all village idiots.
Revenge...kill them all. I shall. My fellow, heh..."village idiots" shall be arriving soon. That's where the fun will start.
I SHOW THEM WHO THE REAL VILLAGE IDIOTS ARE!! MOOOOOOO HAHAHA...ha

Rules
[Stolen(before editing) from Salamence20]:

The Basics:
1] Play to win. Nobody wants to be a loser.
2] Do not take screenshots or directly quote any of the PMs that I send you. Doing so will result in a mod-kill. Pretending to break this rule is the same as actually breaking it. You may paraphrase, but use caution. When in doubt, run it by me first.
3] Do not edit any of your posts, if you have the ability to do so.
4] Do not use encrypted text, hidden text, small text, or any other hard-to-read text when posting.
5] Once you have been lynched or killed, you are out of the game. Do not post anymore until the game is over. That means no "Bah!" posts, please.
6] Do not talk about this game with anybody else outside of this thread unless your role PM explicitly says that you can.
7] Heated discussion is fine, but personal attacks, insults, flaming, and poor sportsmanship are not. Please don't be a jerk to your fellow players. If I feel that your behavior is preventing other players from enjoying the game, I reserve the right to force-replace or mod-kill you.
8] Do not talk about ongoing games. Like really, come on...

Day, Night, and Twilight:
9] Each Day phase will last for two weeks apiece and each Night phase will last for two days. I will post specific deadlines in the game thread at the start of every Day and Night phase.
10] Players may continue to talk during Twilight, including the player that has been lynched.
11] If you do not send me your Night action before the specified deadline, I will assume that you are not performing an action on that Night.
12] If you know you will be unavailable during a Night phase, you may send me your night action during the preceding Day phase if you so desire.
13] Deadline extension requests will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Voting:
14] Please post all votes and unvotes using either the bold tag or the vote tag. Nicknames are fine, as long as I can understand them. Votes should look like this: Vote:Boonskiies or VOTE: Boon
15] Unvotes are helpful, but not necessary.
16] Please refrain from engaging in any kind of voting trickery. If it looks like a vote, I'm counting it as a vote.
17] A lynch will only occur when a majority (more than 50% of all possible votes) is reached. The number of votes needed to hammer will be included with every vote count.
18] If a majority is not reached by the deadline, there will be no lynch on that Day.
19] Once a hammer occurs, no votes or unvotes will prevent the lynch from happening.
20] Additional votes include VOTE: No Lynch to end the Day with no lynch (which will also require a majority) and VOTE: Draw to end the game in a draw (which will require 100% agreement from all living players).

Activity:
21] You will be expected to post at least once every 48 hours. If you go more than 48 hours without posting, you will be prodded.
22] If you receive a prod, you will have 24 hours to post in the game thread. If you do not respond to your prod within 24 hours, you will be replaced. Additionally, if I have to prod you more than three times, you will be replaced.
23] If you know that you will have limited access to the game for more than a few days, please let me know either in the thread or via PM.

Communication with the Moderator:
24] I may be pretty close to perfect, but I do still make mistakes every now and then. If you notice an error with the vote counts, deadlines, or anything else related to the game, please let me know and I will correct the issue.
25] I will not answer any role-related questions in the game thread. If you have any questions about your role, the (theoretical) roles of any other players in the game, or (theoretical) role interactions, send me a PM. Do not try to trick me into confirming a player's role. I will not be amused.
26] If you need to get my attention, just include @Mod or @Boon in your post. Also, bolding will help catch my eye.

Miscellaneous:
27] If you have any problems with another player, send me a PM and I will do my best to resolve the issue.
28] If a player is mod-killed during the Day phase, then that Day will end immediately.
29] My color is Purple (#800080) DON’T USE IT.
30] The flavor text is for entertainment purposes only. Analyze it at your own risk.
31] Do not ask me to mod-kill, force-replace, or discipline any other player in the game. That is my decision to make, not yours.
32] As the moderator, my word is final. Please respect my instructions and my decisions.
33] I reserve the right to change these rules during the game if necessary. If this happens, I will inform everybody of the rule change in the thread.
34] In addition to these rules, all site-wide rules also apply.
35] Claiming color code is prohibited.
36] I live in California, and have Pacific Standard Time.


Sample Vanilla Townie:
37] At least one person will receive this PM.

Welcome, [Player Name], you are a Vanilla Townie.

Abilities:
• During the day, you can vote and talk
• You do nothing special.

Win condition:
You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least one town player alive.

Game thread is here. Confirm by replying to this PM with your role name.

Role PM's will be sent out shortly. Game will start when 10/13 people have confirmed. Confirmed players will be bolded in the player list. Unconfirmed players will have 24 hours to confirm/post or will be prodded.

Confirm by responding to your role PM.
10/13 people have confirmed. Begin day 1...tee hee.

All right, I've finished reading Day 2. As I mentioned before, there is guaranteed to be at least one Mafia on the Massive wagon. As a side note, I once again found myself not liking Pisskop's play on Day 2. However, that is not my focus right now, since I know that there must be Mafia on the wagon itself (living players: Anen, BBT, Varsoon, Flubber).

Anen
Day 2 was a good day for Anen. He was correctly pushing the Massive wagon in a way that accords well with his claimed Night 1 result. His vote on the Massive wagon was well-reasoned. I like the vote. The one thing that was possibly strange was the way that he persistently read BBT (and Radiant, for that matter) as Town, but I have decided that Anen's claimed thoughts are largely trustworthy.

BBT
BBT spends a lot of time in position to drop a hammer on Massive but does not do so immediately. He spends appropriate time looking at Anen's ISO (which was not that great for Day 1). The vote goes on just as the time is running out. I like the vote, as I think that a Mafia player could more easily have fabricated a case on Massive and then dropped the hammer.

Varsoon
Varsoon casts the final vote for Massive as time runs out. There's nothing especially alignment-indicative about this to me. It seems that I've been saying this for the entire game, but I really would like to see more content from Varsoon in order to get a better read. However, TT seemed to be putting significant effort in to attempt to solve the game before replacing out. The vote in Post 592 looks good to me. Such a strong push (also seen in Post 595 and Post 616) seems to me much more like Town against perceived Mafia than as Mafia against perceived Town (as Massive would have been perceived by all Mafia players at that point).

Flubber
The vote for Massive in Post 804 carries no explanation and is obviously without meaningful effort. Perhaps worse, it seems as though the intent was to justify the vote retroactively in Post 876. BBT already pointed these things out in Post 1407. Finally, I should note that if Anen and Massive were both perceived as Town by the Mafia players, then Flubber's stated willingness to vote either makes sense as awaiting the argument to turn clearly against one or the other (as it did) before casting a vote (as he did).

In summary: I find Flubber's vote on the Massive wagon to be the worst, and would certainly prefer to lynch Flubber to any of the other players on that wagon (Anen, Varsoon, or BBT). My next step is to determine whether I would prefer to lynch Flubber now or vote for the no-lynch option and which player I would think is on a team with Flubber.

Oh, two things to help me make up my mind:
1. I still don't actually see confirmation that Anen was telling the truth about his lack of result initially today. Again, though, I don't see how that would be a viable lie. Still, we shouldn't proceed to a lynch without a more definite answer there.
2. I want to check a theory against all night results.

Night 4: Pisskop does not act. Either Flubber or his partner (Varsoon) kills Titus.
